DataElement.preferredName: Body Surface Area Head and Neck Assessment Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numerical percentage value of the BSA assessment for the head and neck.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Body Surface Area Head and Neck Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.:For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A measure of the 2-dimensional extent of the body surface (i.e., the skin).  Body surface area (BSA) can be calculated by mathematical formula or from a chart that relates height to weight.  BSA is often an important factor in dosing.
